articles.description: DEIR AL-BALAH, Gaza Strip (AP) — An Israeli strike on a school where displaced people were sheltering in the central Gaza Strip killed at least 16 people on Thursday, Palestinian medical officials said.
articles.title: Palestinian officials say an Israeli strike on a school-turned-shelter in Gaza has killed 16

articles.author: DAN MERICA
articles.description: ASTON, Pa. (AP) — Vice President Kamala Harris said Wednesday that she believes that Donald Trump "is a fascist” after his longest-serving chief of staff said the former president praised Adolf Hitler while in office and put personal loyalty above the Constitution.
articles.title: Harris says Trump 'is a fascist' after John Kelly says he wanted generals like Hitler's

articles.author: AMANDA SEITZ and DARLENE SUPERVILLE
articles.description: WINSTON-SALEM, N.C. (AP) — The TikTok videos haunt 26-year-old Christy Kishbaugh.One seared into her memory shows a young mom talking about how several Idaho emergency rooms rejected her because of the state's abortion ban, leaving her to bleed for weeks after a miscarriage.
articles.title: Abortion bans are top of mind for young women in North Carolina as they consider Harris or Trump

articles.description: DEIR AL-BALAH, Gaza Strip (AP) — An Israeli strike on a school where displaced people were sheltering in the central Gaza Strip killed at least 16 people on Thursday, Palestinian medical officials said.
articles.title: Palestinian officials say an Israeli strike on a school-turned-shelter in Gaza has killed 16

articles.author: BASSEM MROUE
articles.description: BEIRUT (AP) — Inside what was once one of Beirut’s oldest and best-known cinemas, dozens of Lebanese, Palestinians and Syrians displaced by the Israel-Hezbollah war spend their time following the news on their phones, cooking, chatting and walking around to pass the time.
articles.title: Massive displacement from Israel-Hezbollah war transforms Beirut’s famed commercial street

articles.author: SYLVIE CORBET
articles.description: PARIS (AP) — France pledged to provide a 100-million euro ($108-million) package to support Lebanon at an international conference Thursday, as President Emmanuel Macron said “massive aid” is needed to support the country where war between Hezbollah militants and Israel has displaced a million people, killed over 2,500 and deepened an economic crisis.
articles.title: Macron says France will provide 100 million-euro aid package to support Lebanon

articles.description: KAZAN, Russia (AP) — Russian President Vladimir Putin on Thursday presided over a closing session of a summit of the BRICS bloc of developing economies, hailing its role as a counterbalance to the West.
articles.title: Putin presides over BRICS summit seeking to expand Russia's clout

articles.author: DAVID KLEPPER
articles.description: WASHINGTON (AP) — Russia has helped amplify and spread false and misleading internet claims about recent hurricanes in the United States and the federal government's response, part of a wider effort by the Kremlin to manipulate America's political discourse before the presidential election, new research shows.
articles.title: Russia amplified hurricane disinformation to drive Americans apart, researchers find

articles.author: JOSH BOAK
articles.description: WASHINGTON (AP) — If the presidential election hinged on abortion or climate change, Kamala Harris might be feeling pretty comfortable about her chances on Nov.
articles.title: Voters trust Harris on a number of issues. But is that what they'll vote on?

articles.author: RODNEY MUHUMUZA and GASPARD MAHEBURWA
articles.description: NGOZI, Burundi (AP) — The hug between the two women looked like it would last forever. A spirited 85-year-old had embraced a younger woman she hadn’t seen for months, and she chanted a number of questions in the peculiar yodeling routine of her ancestors.
articles.title: A melodic greeting between women in Burundi is at risk of being lost
